title: LA Rams star Todd Gurley reveals his plans to launch acting career after the NFL
text:
NFL superstar Todd Gurley has revealed he hopes to start a Hollywood career in acting once he hangs up his cleats.

The LA Rams running back, who boasts a stellar reputation as a touchdown king, believes he's got what it takes to shine in Tinseltown.

In an exclusive interview with DailyMailTV, Gurley, 25, said: 'I'm a pretty good looking guy', adding that he's 'pretty sure' screen roles will be on the table.

Gurley says he has already begun secretly planning some content for a career on the big screen.

Todd Gurley, 25, has revealed he hopes to start a Hollywood career in acting once he hangs up his cleats, he exclusively told DailyMailTV. The LA Rams running back said: 'I'm a pretty good looking guy', adding he is 'pretty sure' screen roles will be on the table

He said: 'I have been working on some stuff behind the scenes with my buddy. I am a behind the scenes type of guy.

'That is definitely something I am looking forward to post my NFL career, definitely. There's some stuff I definitely want to learn about and make some cameos, here and there.'

He confirmed that acting 'for sure' is in his future career, adding: 'Just being in Hollywood why not?'

Gurley continued: 'There are so many resources around here. I think I'm a pretty good looking guy so I am pretty sure I can fit in there somewhere.'

Asked if he could see himself emulating the career of former Canadian Football League player turned WWE wrestler, turned Hollywood superstar Dwayne Johnson, he smiled: 'Anything is possible.'

Gurley added that being on screen is fun and he is proud of his recent Hulu commercial promoting their live sports content

Gurley added that being on screen is fun and he is proud of his recent Hulu commercial promoting their live sports content.

'I am always big into content, definitely just putting out good things on my social media. There has been stuff I have been interested in.

'Obviously just watching LeBron and the Uninterrupted team with Jimmy and Mav, those guys are good guys. Then for me to be able to work with Hulu and have that relationship with them, it is an interest for me.'

Gurley, whose Rams took on the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday night, says his Hollywood dreams will not get in the way of his strong football career.

He said that balancing his sports commitment with his life in Hollywood is already under control.

Gurley, whose Rams took on the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday, says that his Hollywood dreams will not get in the way of his strong football career. He said balancing his sports commitment with his life in Hollywood is already under control

Gurley added: 'It is cool. There is a lot of temptation, but as long as you know who you are as a person, and when to party and when not to party, it's cool.

'Being here in LA you have got everything. All the awards shows are here, two sports teams for each sport basically, there is always something going on.

'Then when you want to grab a drink, grab a bite to eat, then you can come into the city. I love being in Hollywood, for sure.'

Gurley spoke at the Audi Party at Sunset Tower. Audi is the official automotive partner of the Television Academy.
description: Todd Gurley, 25, has revealed he hopes to start a Hollywood career in acting once he hangs up his cleats, he exclusively told DailyMailTV. The LA Rams star already appeared in a Hulu ad.
